III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is non-contracted and therefore not required to follow MISEP.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1.
The facility is non-contracted and therefore not required to follow DHHS policy.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation regarding restraints, as DCWL is now reviewing
all restraints that occur in licensed facilities.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. A CAP was approved on 1/6/2020 as a
result of the 12/30/19 interim review. The agency was cited for rule R400.4113 for late
employee evaluations and rule R400.4166 for missing discharge plans. The CAP
included additional oversight and tracking by the supervisors and administrator. As of
this review period the facility is in compliance with both rules and additional corrective
action is not required.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
